title: Why do some electronics work properly even if the power supply is unstable?
body:
Example: lights flicker, fan slows down. Laptop: nothing happens. TV: nothing happens.

Does it have something to do with the AC -> DC power converter built into most complex electronic devices? I don't remember my Physics too well tbh.

(And if there isn't one attached to my TV's power cord, I assume there IS one built into the actual TV itself?)
